tit.e: The Yoshino Pact (a pact concluded with Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito about the enthronement of Prince Kusakabe)
The Yoshino Pact (a pact concluded with Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito about the enthronement of Prince Kusakabe)

sen.j: 吉野の盟約とは天武天皇と皇后の持統天皇がその間にもうけた草壁皇子を次期天皇であると宣言した盟約。
sen.e: The Yoshino pact was created by Emperor Tenmu and his Empress who was later known as Emperor Jito promising their son, Prince Kusakabe, to be the next emperor.
sen.cmt: この時期の皇后は、まだ持統天皇になっていなかったので、"後の”を入れたほうが良いと思います。
sen.e: The Yoshino pact was concluded by Emperor Tenmu and his empress who was later known as Empress Jito promising their son, Prince Kusakabe, to be the next emperor.

sen.j: 草壁皇子ら皇族に彼を次期天皇とし、お互い助けて相争わない事を誓わせた。
sen.e: Members of the Imperial family including the Prince Kusakabe were sworn to accept that Prince Kusakabe would become the next emperor, and to help him and avoid any conflicts with one another.

sen.j: その皇族の一人、志貴皇子は兄天智天皇の第7皇子であったが、この盟約が記録上初の登場であった。
sen.e: Prince Shiki, a member of the Imperial familiy, was the seventh prince of Emperor Tenchi who was the older brother of Prince Kusakabe; however, Prince Shiki's name was never revealed in any records prior to the Yoshino Pact.
Prince Shiki, a member of the Imperial family, was the seventh prince of Emperor Tenchi who was the older brother of Prince Kusakabe, and never appeared in any records prior to the Yoshino Pact.

sen.j: 681(天武10)年には草壁は皇太子となるが、器量優れたライバルの大津皇子も政治に参加する事となり結局天武天皇の後継は曖昧なものとなってしまった。
sen.e: At the time when Kusakabe became prince in 681 AD, Prince Otsu, a capable rival, became involved in the politics of the region; thus, the successor of Emperor Tenmu became uncertain.
At the time when Kusakabe became the Crown Prince in 681, Prince Otsu, a capable rival, became involved in the politics of the region; thus, the successor of Emperor Tenmu became uncertain.

sen.j: そして、そうした内に天皇は崩御し、大津皇子は謀反の疑いをかけられて非業の最後を遂げた。
sen.e: Prince Otsu was suspected of initiating a rebellion to overthrow the emperor, but died an unnatural death prior to its onset; moreover, the emperor also died around the same time.

sen.e: Meanwhile, the Emperor died and Prince Otsu met unfortunate end on suspicion of a rebellion.

sen.j: 草壁もまもなく夭折し、鸕野讚良が高市皇子等有力跡継ぎ候補を無視して自ら正式に持統天皇として即位するのである。
sen.e: Prince Kusakabe also passed away around the same time and Uno no Sarara ignored other rightful successors such as the Prince Takechi and officially enthroned herself to be Emperor Jito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
